content.raw:
The length of time we leave deprecations in place is a balance between making end users' lives easier and allowing code to progress. 

We have been following the tick-tock model since gazebo 1, and have received no complaints so far. I don't see a reason to change our methodology based on a hypothetical scenario.

Users should expect API changes between major versions. Also, there is nothing we can do if a user jumps multiple versions.
